result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard D. Stevens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $100 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample Unless previously provided and pay surcharge.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Yesenia S, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: Ct. 2
Ct. 1
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Richard D. Stevens, appeared with Attorney Douglas I. Henderson.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.   Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 9 months with conditions concurrent to 15CM437.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA Sample and notice to report to KSD to submit sample given to DE.  Fined $100 plus costs and surcharges to be paid during probation.  No contact with Yesenia S. unless permitted by the court/agent.  Appeal Rights given.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

1:30 pm    Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney James Fields-Bowers.  Clerk:  LE.  Plea of not guilty entered.  Def does not qualify for SPD.  PTC 6-26-15 @ 2:40 & FPT 7-2-15 @ 8:30 with 15CM437.  $1000 signature bond set with conditions.

*No Contact w/YS (dob 2/2/86), Deft's 2 children, or their residences.
